result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J Struve was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert J Struve is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert J Struve was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Robert J Struve was found guilty of Manuf/Deliver Designer Drugs (<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(hm)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Deferred Agreement in effect in Count 2 of the Information for the duration of Probation.  Set up payment plan within 30 days with the agent.

miscConds.notes: Plus supervision fees.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.    $250 represents DNA surcharge.  $150 represents Drug Reimbursement Buy money.  $240 represents Drug Reimbursement Buy money.
Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

Not to possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substance not prescribed by authorized medical personnel.  Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs.  Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to associate with anyone using or possessing illegal drugs.
To be expunged upon successful completion of probation per 973.015.
Submit a DNA sample.  Forfeit all seized property.  Repay all buy monies.  Apply to TAD Program and successfully complete, if accepted,

timeConds.notes: May serve in Eau Claire County Jail if at no expense to Chippewa County.  0 days credit.

of Sentencing after Revocation hearing on February 8, 2021

Cases# 15CF92 and 17CF575
03:11 PM Defendant Robert J Struve in court with Attorney Karl A Schmidt.  Defendant Robert J Struve in custody.  Roy La Barton Gay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agent, A. Purcell appears via ZOOM.
Attorney Schmidt states he has reviewed the revocation packet with the defendant; no corrections needed.  States sentencing agreement on the record.
3:15 PM Atty Schmidt asks to talk to ADA Gay for a moment.  Attorneys exit Courtroom.
3:16 PM - Court back in session; Attorneys return; appearances remain the same.  Attorneys agree to amend stipulation to 2 1/2 years IC and 2 1/2 years ES, concurrent on each count. 
Def. chooses not to make a statement.

Case#15CF92, Ct. 2
Court sentences defendant to 5 years in Wisconsin Prison System; 2 1/2 years Initial Confinement and 2 1/2 years of Extended Supervision.
Conditions for Extended Supervision are conditions originally recommended for probation (withheld sentence).
$1,632.08 remaining Court obligations be converted to a civil judgment.
Defendant is eligible for CIP & SAP; defendant given a copy of Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Attorney Schmidt advised to file Post-conviction Relief form.

Case#17CF575, Ct. 1
Court sentences defendant to 5 years in Wisconsin Prison System; 2 1/2 years Initial Confinement and 2 1/2 years of Extended Supervision.  Concurrent to 15CF92.
Conditions for Extended Supervision are conditions originally recommended for probation (withheld sentence).
$ 589.10 remaining Court obligations be converted to a civil judgment.
Defendant is eligible for CIP & SAP; defendant given a copy of Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Attorney Schmidt advised to file Post-conviction Relief form.
247 days of sentence crcedit given.
